document_data.name: Roushoum
document_data.mainbody: '''Roushoum''', also called '''Imaskari''', was the ancient language of the [[Imaskari]] people.
document_data.Speakers: Roushoum continued to be spoken deep in the [[Underdark]] by the survivors of the [[Imaskari Empire]], the [[Deep Imaskari]]. It was subsequently spoken by the [[High Imaskar]]i who ruled over [[Mulhorand]] in the 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Related Languages:
Roushoum was the major language of the [[Imaskari languages]] family.{{Cite dragon annual/1999/Speaking in Tongues|29}} Its many varied descendants included the languages of the [[Durpari]] and the various [[Tuigan]] dialects, including [[Raumvira]]. It had strong influences on the [[Rauric languages|Rauric family of languages]] as well.

The modern variations of Roushoum spoken in the [[Hordelands]] were broken down into three subgroupings of languages for convenience: the [[Northern Imaskari languages|Northern]], [[Southern Imaskari languages|Southern]], and [[Eastern Imaskari languages]].
document_data.Script: Roushoum was written using the [[Imaskari alphabet]].
